sex of the participant_2

species of individuals participating in the study -bonobo/chimpanzee/gorilla/orangutan
name of the two participants that compose the dyad

quantities of food provided to each participant – baseline_1, baseline_2 and baseline_3: in this condition the experimenter gives one food to participant and one to partner four times in a row before the test condition, and four times in a row after the test condition. The number denotes whether the baseline session belongs to the first, second or third day of test.
Equal condition: test condition in which the experimenter gives 1 piece of food to one participant and 3 pieces of food to the other participant. In the next trial, the quantities are reversed. Over eight trials they obtain the same amount of food. Unequal condition: test condition in which the experimenter gives different amounts of food to each participant, one receives 1 piece of food over eight consecutive test trials while the other participant receives 3 pieces of food over eight consecutive trials. Unequal condition parts 1 and 2: these entries belong to the second type of unequal condition. In the first four trials one participant receives 1 piece of food and the other 3 pieces of food. After four trials they reverse the quantities and the individual that previously received 1 piece of food now receives 3 and viceversa. Notice that unequal conditon-parts 1 and 2 belong to the same test session. The rows contain data over 4 trials instead of 8 trials as it is the case for the other unequal condition, the equal condition and the baseline
total duration in which the two participants were close to the food and to each other
the sum of time the participant spent banging performing self-scratching and aggressive behaviour
the time the participant spent begging the experimenter for food
total duration of the session
